question: In which of the following situations a President can establish Inter -State Council?
option2: When council of Ministers recommends him / her to do so
option4: When it appears to him / her that it would be serving the public interest
answer: When it appears to him / her that it would be serving the public interest
explanation: Article 263 of the Constitution of India provides If at any time it appears to the President that the public interest would be served by the establishment of a Inter State Council.
